name: Disarm
description: A creature can use a weapon attack to knock a weapon or another item from a target's grasp. The attacker makes an attack roll contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (target's choice). If the attacker wins the contest, the target drops the item.

mechanics.action: Uses one weapon attack (part of the Attack action or a similar feature that grants weapon attacks)
mechanics.onSuccess: The target drops the item. The item lands at the target's feet in its space.
mechanics.onFailure: No effect. The attack is expended.

modifiers.advantage: The attacker has Advantage on the attack roll if it is wielding a weapon with two hands
modifiers.disadvantage: The attacker has Disadvantage on the attack roll if the target is holding the item with two or more hands

sizeModifiers.description: The target has Advantage on its ability check if it is larger than the attacker, or Disadvantage if it is smaller

limitations: The target must be holding an item that can be dropped (weapons, shields, spellcasting focuses, etc.)
Natural weapons (claws, teeth) and integrated weapons cannot be disarmed
The item drops in the target's space; the target can use its free object interaction on its turn to pick it up
This uses one attack, so a creature with Extra Attack can attempt to disarm and still make remaining attacks

interactions: Fighters and other martial classes with Extra Attack can attempt a disarm and still make additional attacks on the same turn
A disarmed creature can pick up the dropped item using its free object interaction on its turn, so allies should try to kick or grab the item
Shield Master and similar features do not apply since disarm uses an attack roll, not a shove
This is powerful against enemies relying on a single magic weapon or spellcasting focus
The Telekinetic feat or Mage Hand cantrip can be used to move the dropped item away from the disarmed creature
Two-handed weapon users are harder to disarm (Disadvantage for the attacker) but this also means two-handed attackers have Advantage when disarming
